isPreferred.description: May be true for one and only one email record in the collection. Denotes the default email address

purpose.description: The purpose for the email, as specified by the customer (Enumeration)

address.description: A correctly formatted email address, as defined by the addr_spec format in **[[RFC5322]](#nref-RFC5322)**

lastUpdateTime.description: The date and time that this record was last updated by the customer. If no update has occurred then this date should reflect the initial creation date for the data

agentFirstName.description: The first name of the individual providing access on behalf of the organisation. For people with single names this field need not be present.  The single name should be in the lastName field

agentLastName.description: The last name of the individual providing access on behalf of the organisation. For people with single names the single name should be in this field

agentRole.description: The role of the individual identified as the agent who is providing authorisation.  Expected to be used for display. Default to Unspecified if the role is not known

legalName.description: Legal name, if different to the business name

shortName.description: Short name used for communication, if different to the business name

abn.description: Australian Business Number for the organisation

acn.description: Australian Company Number for the organisation. Required only if an ACN is applicable for the organisation type

isACNCRegistered.description: True if registered with the ACNC.  False if not. Absent or null if not confirmed.

industryCode.description: A valid [ANZSIC](http://www.abs.gov.au/ANZSIC) code for the organisation. If the industry code held by the data holder is not one of the supported [ANZSIC](http://www.abs.gov.au/ANZSIC) versions, then it must not be supplied.

industryCodeVersion.description: The applicable [ANZSIC](http://www.abs.gov.au/ANZSIC) release version of the industry code provided. Should only be supplied if ``industryCode`` is also supplied. If ``industryCode`` is supplied but ``industryCodeVersion`` is absent, default is ``ANZSIC_1292.0_2006_V2.0``

registeredCountry.description: Enumeration with values from [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country codes.  Assumed to be AUS if absent

establishmentDate.description: The date the organisation described was established

physicalAddresses.description: Array is mandatory but may be empty if no valid addresses are held. One and only one address may have the purpose of REGISTERED. Zero or one, and no more than one, record may have the purpose of MAIL. If zero then the REGISTERED address is to be used for mail

dpid.description: Unique identifier for an address as defined by Australia Post.  Also known as Delivery Point Identifier

thoroughfareNumber1.description: Thoroughfare number for a property (first number in a property ranged address)

thoroughfareNumber1Suffix.description: Suffix for the thoroughfare number. Only relevant is thoroughfareNumber1 is populated

thoroughfareNumber2.description: Second thoroughfare number (only used if the property has a ranged address eg 23-25)

thoroughfareNumber2Suffix.description: Suffix for the second thoroughfare number. Only relevant is thoroughfareNumber2 is populated

flatUnitType.description: Type of flat or unit for the address

floorLevelType.description: Type of floor or level for the address

floorLevelNumber.description: Floor or level number (including alpha characters)

streetType.description: The street type. Valid enumeration defined by Australia Post PAF code file

streetSuffix.description: The street type suffix. Valid enumeration defined by Australia Post PAF code file

postalDeliveryType.description: Postal delivery type. (eg. PO BOX). Valid enumeration defined by Australia Post PAF code file

postalDeliveryNumber.description: Postal delivery number if the address is a postal delivery type

postalDeliveryNumberPrefix.description: Postal delivery number prefix related to the postal delivery number

postalDeliveryNumberSuffix.description: Postal delivery number suffix related to the postal delivery number

state.description: State in which the address belongs. Valid enumeration defined by Australia Post PAF code file [State Type Abbreviation](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf). NSW, QLD, VIC, NT, WA, SA, TAS, ACT, AAT

CommonPAFAddress.description: Australian address formatted according to the file format defined by the [PAF file format](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf)

lastUpdateTime.description: The date and time that this record was last updated by the customer.  If no update has occurred then this date should reflect the initial creation date for the data

firstName.description: For people with single names this field need not be present. The single name should be in the lastName field. Where a data holder cannot determine first and middle names from a collection of given names, a single string representing all given names MAY be provided.

lastName.description: For people with single names the single name should be in this field

middleNames.description: Field is mandatory but array may be empty

prefix.description: Also known as title or salutation.  The prefix to the name (e.g. Mr, Mrs, Ms, Miss, Sir, etc)

suffix.description: Used for a trailing suffix to the name (e.g. Jr)

occupationCode.description: Value is a valid **[[ANZSCO]](#iref-ANZSCO)** Standard Occupation classification code. If the occupation code held by the data holder is not one of the supported **[[ANZSCO]](#iref-ANZSCO)** versions, then it must not be supplied.

occupationCodeVersion.description: The applicable **[[ANZSCO]](#iref-ANZSCO)** release version of the occupation code provided. Mandatory if an ``occupationCode`` is supplied. If ``occupationCode`` is supplied but ``occupationCodeVersion`` is absent, default is ``ANZSCO_1220.0_2013_V1.2``

phoneNumbers.description: Array is mandatory but may be empty if no phone numbers are held

physicalAddresses.description: Array is mandatory but may be empty if no valid addresses are held. One and only one address may have the purpose of REGISTERED. Zero or one, and no more than one, record may have the purpose of MAIL. If zero then the REGISTERED address is to be used for mail

isPreferred.description: May be true for one and only one entry to indicate the preferred phone number. Assumed to be 'false' if not present

purpose.description: The purpose of the number as specified by the customer

countryCode.description: If absent, assumed to be Australia (+61). The + should be included

areaCode.description: Required for non Mobile Phones, if field is present and refers to Australian code - the leading 0 should be omitted.

number.description: The actual phone number, with leading zeros as appropriate

fullNumber.description: Fully formatted phone number with country code, area code, number and extension incorporated. Formatted according to section 5.1.4. of **[[RFC3966]](#iref-RFC3966)**

addressUType.description: The type of address object present

purpose.description: Enumeration of values indicating the purpose of the physical address

mailingName.description: Name of the individual or business formatted for inclusion in an address used for physical mail

addressLine1.description: First line of the standard address object

addressLine2.description: Second line of the standard address object

addressLine3.description: Third line of the standard address object

city.description: Name of the city or locality

state.description: Free text if the country is not Australia. If country is Australia then must be one of the values defined by the [State Type Abbreviation](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf) in the PAF file format. NSW, QLD, VIC, NT, WA, SA, TAS, ACT, AAT

country.description: A valid [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code. Australia (AUS) is assumed if country is not present.

outageTime.description: Date and time that the outage is scheduled to begin

duration.description: Planned duration of the outage. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) (excludes recurrence syntax)

isPartial.description: Flag that indicates, if present and set to true, that the outage is only partial meaning that only a subset of normally available end points will be affected by the outage

explanation.description: Provides an explanation of the current outage that can be displayed to an end customer

self.description: Fully qualified link that generated the current response document
Fully qualified link that generated the current response document

first.description: URI to the first page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

prev.description: URI to the previous page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

next.description: URI to the next page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

last.description: URI to the last page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

urn.description: The CDR error code URN which the application-specific error code extends. Mandatory if the error `code` is an application-specific error rather than a standardised error code.

MetaError.description: Additional data for customised error codes

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the full set. See [pagination](#pagination).

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in the full set. See [pagination](#pagination).

customerUType.description: The type of customer object that is present
The type of customer object that is present

status.description: Enumeration with values. OK (implementation is fully functional). PARTIAL_FAILURE (one or more end points are unexpectedly unavailable). UNAVAILABLE (the full implementation is unexpectedly unavailable). SCHEDULED_OUTAGE (an advertised outage is in effect)

explanation.description: Provides an explanation of the current outage that can be displayed to an end customer. Mandatory if the status property is any value other than OK

detectionTime.description: The date and time that the current outage was detected. Should only be present if the status property is PARTIAL_FAILURE or UNAVAILABLE

expectedResolutionTime.description: The date and time that full service is expected to resume (if known). Should not be present if the status property has a value of OK.

updateTime.description: The date and time that this status was last updated by the Data Holder.

outages.description: List of scheduled outages. Property is mandatory but may contain and empty list if no outages are scheduled

code.description: The code of the error encountered. Where the error is specific to the respondent, an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value. If the error is application-specific, the URN code that the specific error extends must be provided in the meta object. Otherwise, the value is the error code URN.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that MUST NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem represented by the error code.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

currentMonth.description: Percentage availability of the CDR platform so far for the current calendar month. 0.0 means 0%. 1.0 means 100%.

previousMonths.description: Percentage availability of the CDR platform for previous calendar months. The first element indicates the last month and so on. A maximum of twelve entries is required if available. 0.0 means 0%. 1.0 means 100%.

AvailabilityMetrics.description: Percentage availability of the CDR platform over time

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

unauthenticated.description: Average response time for the unauthenticated tier

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

highPriority.description: Average response time for the high priority tier

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

lowPriority.description: Average response time for the low priority tier

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

unattended.description: Average response time for the unattended tier

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

largePayload.description: Average response time for the large payload tier

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

primary.description: Average response time as measured for the primary data holder

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

secondary.description: Average response time as measured for the secondary data holder
Average response time for the secondary tier.  Mandatory for data holders designated for a Shared Responsibility Data Request data cluster

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

primary.description: Average response time as measured for the primary data holder

currentDay.description: Average response time for current day

previousDays.description: Average response time for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

secondary.description: Average response time as measured for the secondary data holder

largeSecondary.description: Average response time for the large payload tier.  Mandatory for data holders designated for a Shared Responsibility Data Request data cluster

AverageResponseMetricsV2.description: Average response time in seconds, at millisecond resolution, within each performance tier

currentDay.description: Average TPS for current day

previousDays.description: Average TPS for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

currentDay.description: Number of errors for current day

previousDays.description: Number of errors for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

ErrorMetrics.description: Number of calls resulting in error due to server execution over time

currentDay.description: API call counts for current day

previousDays.description: API call counts for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

unauthenticated.description: API call counts for the unauthenticated tier

currentDay.description: API call counts for current day

previousDays.description: API call counts for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

highPriority.description: API call counts for the high priority tier

currentDay.description: API call counts for current day

previousDays.description: API call counts for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

lowPriority.description: API call counts for the low priority tier

currentDay.description: API call counts for current day

previousDays.description: API call counts for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

unattended.description: API call counts for the unattended tier

currentDay.description: API call counts for current day

previousDays.description: API call counts for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

largePayload.description: API call counts for the large payload tier

currentDay.description: API call counts for current day

previousDays.description: API call counts for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

secondary.description: API call counts for the Shared Responsibility Data Requests tier.  Mandatory for data holders designated for a Shared Responsibility Data Request data cluster

currentDay.description: API call counts for current day

previousDays.description: API call counts for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

largeSecondary.description: API call counts for the large Shared Responsibility Data Requests tier.  Mandatory for data holders designated for a Shared Responsibility Data Request data cluster

InvocationMetricsV2.description: Number of API calls in each performance tier over time

self.description: Fully qualified link to this API call

urn.description: The CDR error code URN which the application-specific error code extends. Mandatory if the error `code` is an application-specific error rather than a standardised error code.

MetaError.description: Additional data for customised error codes

currentDay.description: Peak TPS for current day

previousDays.description: Peak TPS for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

PeakTPSMetrics.description: Maximum record transactions per second over time

currentDay.description: Percentage of calls within the performance threshold for the current day. 0.0 means 0%. 1.0 means 100%

previousDays.description: Percentage of calls within the performance threshold for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available. 0.0 means 0%. 1.0 means 100%

PerformanceMetrics.description: Percentage of calls within the performance thresholds

currentDay.description: Number of calls rejected for current day

previousDays.description: Number of calls rejected for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

authenticated.description: Rejection counts for all authenticated end points

currentDay.description: Number of calls rejected for current day

previousDays.description: Number of calls rejected for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available.

unauthenticated.description: Rejection counts for all uauthenticated end points

RejectionMetricsV2.description: Number of calls rejected due to traffic thresholds over time

action.description: The action to take for the meta data. At the moment the only option is REFRESH which requires the data holder to call the ACCC to refresh meta data as soon as practicable

code.description: The code of the error encountered. Where the error is specific to the respondent, an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value. If the error is application-specific, the URN code that the specific error extends must be provided in the meta object. Otherwise, the value is the error code URN.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that MUST NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem represented by the error code.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

requestTime.description: The date and time that the metrics in this payload were requested.

customerCount.description: Number of customers with active authorisations at the time of the call

recipientCount.description: Number of Data Recipient Software Products with active authorisations at the time of the call

currentDay.description: Number of errors for current day

previousDays.description: Number of errors for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

errors.description: Number of calls resulting in error due to server execution over time

currentDay.description: Number of rejections for current day

previousDays.description: Number of rejections for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

rejections.description: Number of calls resulting in a rejection due to server execution over time

SecondaryHolderMetrics.description: Errors and rejections received by the primary data holder from the secondary data holder.  Mandatory for data holders designated for a Shared Responsibility Data Request data cluster

currentDay.description: Session count for current day

previousDays.description: Session count for previous days. The first element indicates yesterday and so on. A maximum of seven entries is required if available

SessionCountMetrics.description: Session counts over time. Note that a session is defined as the provisioning of an Access Token.
